page.title: 05LIVING ON ST.MICHAEL'S MOUNT
page.content:
The Mount is a very special place to live. It is fun for children to have friends to stay and children from the mainland enjoy going there.
There are some disadvantages. The children go to school in Marazion. With care, a car or Landrover can be driven across the narrow causeway at low tide, but at high tide people have to cross by boat to the mainland. There is an amphibious vehicle, or "duck", for use when the sea has covered the causeway but is too shallow for a boat. In really bad weather people can be stranded for several days in Marazion or on the Mount. This could be particularly serious if someone was ill or injured and needed medical help. In the winter the sea can come right up to the front doors of the cottages and flood them.
